meanings.definition: The quality or state of being superplastic.
meanings.sent1: The superplasticities of the metal allowed it to be easily molded into intricate shapes.
meanings.sent2: The superplasticities of the clay made it ideal for sculpting detailed figurines.
meanings.sent3: The superplasticities of the rubber band made it stretchy enough to launch paper airplanes.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had the superplasticities of a rubber band, always able to adapt to new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The superplasticities of the fabric were so remarkable that it could be twisted and turned in any way.

meanings.definition: The ability of a material to undergo significant deformation without fracturing.
meanings.sent1: The superplasticities of the metal allowed it to be stretched without breaking.
meanings.sent2: The superplasticities of the plastic made it durable under pressure.
meanings.sent3: The superplasticities of the bubblegum were tested by blowing the biggest bubble possible.
meanings.sent4: The superplasticities of the tree branches enabled them to sway gracefully in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The superplasticities of the rubber band were so impressive that it could be pulled to great lengths without snapping.
